intro: Hieracium briziflorum subsp. aemuliflorum, commonly known as the mimic hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. It is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain regions.
